error_details.explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_cupcakes' (24) was used instead of 'candles_per_cupcake_half2' (2).

context.question: N/A
context.flawed_solution:
#### 270
For half of the cupcakes, Stephanie wants to use 1 candle each. Since half of the cupcakes is 24/2 and she plans to use 1 candle each for this half of the cupcakes, Stephanie needs (24/2)*1 = <<24/2*1=12>>12 candles for this half of the cupcakes.
For the other half of the cupcakes, Stephanie wants to use 24 candles. Therefore, she will need (24/2)*24 =<<24/2*24=288>>288 candles for this half of the cupcakes.
Because Stephanie needs 12 candles for half of the cupcakes and 288 candles for the other half, she needs a total of 12+288=<<12+288=300>>300 candles.
Since Stephanie needs 300 candles to decorate all the cupcakes and she currently has 30 candles, Stephanie needs 300-30= <<300-30=270>>270 additional candles.
